meanings.definition: To drink more alcohol than someone else.
meanings.sent1: Last night, Sarah outdrank all her friends at the party.
meanings.sent2: He always outdrank his buddies during their weekly gatherings.
meanings.sent3: The tiny mouse outdrank the big elephant at the watering hole.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to outdrink her opponent was as fierce as a lion's roar.
meanings.sent5: The image of her outdrinking everyone at the bar was etched in his memory.

meanings.definition: To have drunk more alcohol than someone else in the past.
meanings.sent1: In college, he outdrank all his roommates and earned the title of 'Champion Drinker'.
meanings.sent2: She outdrank her siblings at every family gathering when they were younger.
meanings.sent3: The ancient king outdrank all his subjects at the grand feast.
meanings.sent4: His legendary tales of outdrinking his rivals spread far and wide.
meanings.sent5: The thought of him having outdrank his opponents in the past amused his friends.
